title: Time Management Software
content:
Shopping around for a time tracking program that handles multiple projects and tracks hours, etc.

Anyone had any success or failures here? Any ideas would be appreciated.

CHeers

James
author: James Scriven

comments.content:
I tried Harvest briefly and it was pretty solid and easy to use. There's a stopwatch or you can track hours manually. I wasn't tracking multiple projects so I didn't purchase after the trial period but a friend of mine swears by it.

[http://www.getharvest.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145214/http:/www.getharvest.com/ "http://www.getharvest.com/")

I use iBiz from Igg Software. I've been using it for quite a while and think it's pretty good.

Here's the link:  
 [http://www.iggsoftware.com/ibiz/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145214/http:/www.iggsoftware.com/ibiz/ "http://www.iggsoftware.com/ibiz/")

--  
Ragnar Freyr  
 [www.ragnarfreyr.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145214/http:/www.ragnarfreyr.com/ "www.ragnarfreyr.com")

You may find something here... [http://www.tucows.com/Windows/Business/Management/TimeResourceManagement](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145214/http:/www.tucows.com/Windows/Business/Management/TimeResourceManagement "http://www.tucows.com/Windows/Business/Management/TimeResourceManagement")

Or here...

[http://www.tucows.com/Windows/Business/Management/TimeClock](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145214/http:/www.tucows.com/Windows/Business/Management/TimeClock "http://www.tucows.com/Windows/Business/Management/TimeClock")

Or I suspect you may want to click on the Macntosh tab if you're that way inclined.

<cite>Shopping around for a time tracking program that handles multiple projects and tracks hours</cite>

You should check Fanurio. It is a desktop app that does both. It has a nice mini view window for tracking time.
